intro: Cephalophora integrifolia, commonly known as the smooth-leaved cephalophora, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melanthiaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in grassland and rocky habitats. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of broad, smooth, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in a dense, terminal cluster. Cephalophora integrifolia is often found in dry, well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought.
